headline.main: World Briefing | Asia: India: 13 Die In Kashmir Battle

lead_paragraph: An Indian Army spokesman in the state of Jammu and Kashmir said at least five soldiers and eight Islamic militants had been killed in a gun battle in the Surankot district after an army convoy was attacked in a forest. He blamed Lashkar-e-Toiba, a group of Islamic holy warriors based in Pakistan that wants predominantly Muslim Kashmir to be part of Islamic Pakistan. The group's attacks in Kashmir have intensified India's denunciations of Pakistan for harboring terrorists. Pakistan calls them freedom fighters. Celia W. Dugger (NYT)
abstract: Indian Army reports at least five soldiers and eight Islamic militants were killed in gun battle, Surankot, Kashmir and Jammu; blames Lashkar-e-Toiba, Pakistan-based group of Islamic holy warriors (S)
